title: Encyclopedia Database
description: A comprehensive database of plant species with detailed information on their characteristics, habitats, and care instructions.

diseases.description: A fungal disease that appears as white powdery spots on leaves and stems.
diseases.treatment: Remove affected leaves, improve air circulation, and apply fungicides if necessary.

diseases.description: A condition caused by overwatering leading to fungal growth in the roots.
diseases.treatment: Reduce watering, improve soil drainage, and repot the plant in fresh soil if needed.

diseases.description: Fungal or bacterial infection causing spots on leaves.
symptoms: Brown or black spots on leaves
diseases.treatment: Remove affected leaves, avoid overhead watering, and apply appropriate fungicides or bactericides.

diseases.description: A common pest problem where small insects feed on plant sap.
symptoms: Presence of small green, black, or white insects
diseases.treatment: Use insecticidal soap, neem oil, or introduce natural predators like ladybugs.

diseases.description: Tiny arachnids that feed on plant sap, causing damage to leaves.
symptoms: Yellow or bronze speckling on leaves
diseases.treatment: Increase humidity, spray with water to dislodge mites, and use miticides if necessary.

diseases.description: A rapid and complete chlorosis, browning, then death of plant tissues.
symptoms: Sudden wilting of leaves and stems
Dark lesions on stems and leaves
diseases.treatment: Remove and destroy affected plant parts, improve air circulation, and apply fungicides.

diseases.description: A fungal disease that causes rust-colored pustules on leaves and stems.
symptoms: Orange or rust-colored spots on leaves
diseases.treatment: Remove affected leaves, avoid overhead watering, and apply fungicides.
